body.p: In addition, the Board concluded that information about an entity’s gain or loss on derecognition and the timing of recognition of that gain or loss provides information about the proportion of an entity’s profit or loss that arises from transferring financial assets in which the entity also retains continuing involvement. Such information is useful in assessing the extent to which an entity generates profits from transferring financial assets while retaining some form of continuing involvement and thus exposure to risk.
